item.title: 007 First Light: IO Interactive Dev Explains the Importance of Gadgets, Cars, and Locations
item.description:
Since he first burst onto the big screen in 1962, the name James Bond has been synonymous with exotic locations, innovative gadgets, high-speed car chases, and high-octane action. 007 First Light is the suave spy's first foray back into the world of video games since 2012's poorly received 007 Legends , so the stage is set for Bond to make one of his famous grand comebacks. Developer IO Interactive is doing its utmost to make that happen.

Game Rant recently sat down with IO Interactive's franchise art director Rasmus Poulsen to talk about how some of James Bond's tropes have been used in 007 First Light . The gadgets, cars, and locations that fans have come to expect from 007 will be present in First Light , but that doesn't necessarily mean fans will always get exactly what they expect.

The James Bond Franchise Has Plenty of Tools in its Arsenal

IO Interactive seems to have understood the assignment in ensuring 007 First Light manages to include all the things that the franchise is so well-known for. Poulsen explained that the team had a lot of fun in ensuring every trope was hit, including cars, locations, and so forth, but they also had fun with these expectations. Living up to them came first, then having fun with them second, but that does mean fans should be mindful of how these various James Bond tropes play out and are possibly subverted to retain an element of surprise for players. When asked which aspects of Bond's world were the most fun to play around with, Poulsen said,

''To be honest, all the tropes have been fun because it's such an exciting place to get into with the locations and the wide variety of places you visit. From low-life crime nests to high-end places for the higher echelons of society, that's totally Bond, right? Characters, car chases, action, all that stuff is really fun because there is an expectation to it, and it's fun to play with that expectation. Sometimes we might give you exactly what you expect, but sometimes weâ€™ll also give you something unexpected. Firstly, we tried to live up to the DNA and the expectations of the character, then thereafter we tried to have some fun with the expectations.''

007 First Light Presented Plenty of Challenges for IOI to Overcome

James Bond has found himself behind the wheel of some amazing cars over the years from the iconic Aston Martin DB5 in 1964's Goldfinger to the Lotus Esprit that doubled as a submarine from The Spy Who Loved Me . For IOI, including cars like the Aston Martin DBS in 007 First Light 's announcement trailer was a no-brainer, but this doesn't mean the actual process of making that happen was straightforward. Poulsen explained,

''With Bond himself, we knew what we wanted there, but getting that live has been a journey in terms of some of the partners we're working with. Aston Martin, for instance. We knew we wanted the DBS, the yellow one you saw in the trailer. That's the one we were super excited about, so that was a given from the start. Then seeing that actually in the game and in high-res was super, super cool. Then there were things like, for instance, the development of Bond's scar, what's too much, what's too little? We've been agonizing about all that stuff.''

Poulsen and the rest of the dev team will be hoping that this attention to detail will help the finished product be as immersive as possible, making the player feel like they've unmistakably stepped into James Bond's world. The best James Bond games are the ones that manage to pull this off successfully, and there's no reason to believe 007 First Light won't add its name to that list when it launches next year.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Reveals New Skins for Invisible Woman and The Thing
item.description:
Summary

  • Future Foundation skins for Invisible Woman and The Thing in Marvel Rivals will be released on June 12 at 7 PM PDT.
  • Flying heroes in the game have led to frustration among many Vanguard players.
  • Mister Fantastic's Future Foundation skin is free in the Combat Chest for Season 2.5.

Marvel Rivals has revealed that it will be releasing new Future Foundation skins for both Invisible Woman and The Thing on June 12 at 7 PM PDT. NetEase Games recently launched its major Season 2.5 update for Marvel Rivals , which added Ultron to the popular hero shooter as a flying Strategist.

Due to the number of flying heroes present in the game, some players have expressed frustration with the state of Vanguards in Marvel Rivals . With three flying Duelists and a Strategist, it's possible for teams to be made up of four flying characters and two grounded heroes. There are even team-ups between these flying characters to encourage players to use them together. Because of this, some Vanguard players feel that they're at an extreme disadvantage on the battlefield. Most Vanguards lack any kind of powerful ranged attack, which means they're almost entirely reliant on teammates to take down flying opponents. Some gamers feel characters like The Thing seem to have taken the biggest hit, as he's both grounded and extremely melee-focused.

In a recent post on Twitter, NetEase Games revealed that players will be able to purchase new Future Foundation skins for The Thing and Invisible Woman in Marvel Rivals . While there's no official word about just how much either skin will cost, they're scheduled to release on June 12 at 7 PM PDT. Both characters are wearing white costumes with blue accents that appear to be more high-tech than their default outfits. Invisible Woman is sporting a shorter haircut than normal, while The Thing's costume actually covers a large portion of his upper body.

Marvel Rivals' Invisible Woman and The Thing Are Getting Future Foundation Skins

Mister Fantastic also has a Future Foundation costume, which is available for free in Marvel Rivals ' Combat Chest for Season 2.5. The MVP animation for Mister Fantastic's costume also features Invisible Woman, The Thing, and Spider-Man in their Future Foundation outfits. While Spider-Man hasn't shown up wearing the costume in the game yet, many players believe it's only a matter of time before he arrives in the store.

NetEase Games recently courted a bit of controversy within the community, as not everyone was happy with Wolverine's Weapon X skin in Marvel Rivals . While some people loved the design, others were upset by seeing the Duelist wearing long pants, which is a major departure from the costume's design in the comics. Some people even brought up Invisible Woman, stating that her revealing Malice costume should mean that Wolverine can be scantily clad as well. Despite a few hiccups here and there, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Marvel Rivals .

item.title: Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound Makes What's Old Feel New Again [Hands-On Preview]
item.description:
2025 is bringing back ninja games in a big way. After a hiatus following the controversial launch of Ninja Gaiden Z: Yaiba , Koei Tecmoâ€™s hardcore action-platformer franchise Ninja Gaiden is back with three whole games targeting the same calendar year. Ninja Gaiden 2 Black opened up with a solid, but familiar starter, and in the hopes of Ninja Gaiden 4 ending on a spectacular Izuna Drop, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound aims to fit a launcher in-between. Paralleled nicely by Shinobi: Art of Vengeance reviving Segaâ€™s own brutal ninja series, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound brings its high-flying hack-and-slash franchise back to its roots.

Developed by The Game Kitchen, the studio behind the Blasphemous series, and published by Dotemu and Joystick, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound harkens back to Ninja Gaiden â€™s 2D days while keeping the complexity that Team Ninjaâ€™s 3D entries introduced. As the first 2D pixelated entry that Ninja Gaiden has seen in over thirty years, Ragebound cuts a striking figure through visuals alone, and everything beneath the gameâ€™s surface strives to follow suit. Game Rant was provided with a roughly one-hour-long preview build to try several sections from the beginning of the game, and even early on, it feels like Ninja Gaiden â€™s comeback tour is going strong.

Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound Ensures Players Are Settled In

Players take control of Kenji Mozu, an apprentice to Ninja Gaiden â€™s protagonist Ryu Hayabusa, and inheritor of most of the latterâ€™s old blue outfit. Ryu is headed to America to honor his fatherâ€™s will, which seems to be a nod to the original NES Ninja Gaiden , so he's training Kenji to defend Hayabusa Village in his absence. That's where Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound â€™s tutorial picks up, and the game quickly establishes exactly what sort of retro throwback it's going for. Being a 2D game, the action is fairly straightforward compared to Ninja Gaiden â€™s 3D hack-and-slash efforts, but that doesn't mean it's less intense.

More than its perspective or pixel art, Ragebound emulates the seriesâ€™ 2D era through its emphasis on forward momentum. A lot of enemies only take one hit to kill, while armored foes can be one-shotted with Hypercharge strikes gained through dispatching specified mooks first. Ragebound â€™s standard action game combo counter tracks kills rather than individual hits, and players are encouraged by stage rankings to deal with their foes quickly to keep moving through Ragebound â€™s linear levels. The game still leaves players breathing room to play it as a stylish action-platformer romp, but even this early on, Ragebound â€™s bones are arranged to please Ninja Gaiden â€™s Master Ninja thrill-seekers.

Combat And Traversal Depth Ensure Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound Never Loses Its Edge

To that end, there's more to Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound â€™s combat than basic slashes and dashes. Progressing through Ryuâ€™s training course, Kenji will learn to employ the Guillotine Boost to launch off enemies and projectiles, serving as a forward-moving version of gamingâ€™s famous pogo jump. Climbing and jumping around walls and ceilings is another way that Ragebound keeps the action flowing, as platforming is interwoven with combat even more than it was in Blasphemous 2 . Ragebound â€™s tutorial stage ends with a brutal fight with Ryu Hayabusa himself, serving as a sort of callback to the 2004 Ninja Gaiden â€™s own first boss, though, fortunately, players aren't required to beat Hayabusaâ€™s finest on their first attempt.

Of course, once Ryu leaves for America, hell literally breaks loose in Hayabusa Village, which has become a common sight in Ninja Gaiden â€™s chronology. Kenji dives into the burning village to repel the invaders, and it's here where Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound starts taking its gloves off. Some of the gameâ€™s tools have yet to be introduced, so players are left on their own to navigate the flames, enemies, and combat rooms, with snappy, simple controls being their strongest weapon. It all culminates in a boss fight with Gurthka, who proves that The Game Kitchenâ€™s ability to animate larger, more intricate foes is still on point, and the player's Blasphemous -like dodge roll needs to match.

Kenji And Kumori Earn Their Place As Ninja Gaiden: Rageboundâ€™s Stars

It's at this point that the other shoe drops, and Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound â€™s second playable character enters the picture. The Ninja Gaiden series' recurring villainous Black Spider Clan is represented by the assassin Kumori, who is forced to inhabit Kenjiâ€™s body. This tense alliance provides the main narrative hook of Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound , as it otherwise opts for the old-school plot of collecting three artifacts, as well as the rest of its mechanics. Ragebound â€™s ranged options are tied to Kumori and her pink energy meter, and performing a screen-clearing attack also requires several pips around the meter to be built up. These options will expand as more weapons and abilities appear in the in-game shop, but what's in the preview proves that even the basics can be enough.

Much of Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound from the protagonist merger onward becomes a series of fast-paced combat puzzles, where the goal of keeping momentum up is the reward for effectively leveraging the playerâ€™s offensive arsenal to best dispatch enemies. Hypercharge now requires players to strike blue-marked foes with Kenji and pink-marked foes with Kumori to ready its armor-busting blow, although armored enemies can be fought normally if combat puzzle-solving isn't going well. Kumori has segments where she can fly solo as well, usually as part of a timed platforming challenge initiated by a Demon Altar to unlock the way forward.

Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound Isn't Merely NG4â€™s Appetizer

All of this comes together to form a surprisingly compelling package that encourages multiple replays to attain mastery, which the brutally tough Ninja Gaiden franchise has always held in high regard. Ragebound â€™s preview build doesn't have enough challenges or tools to push players all the way yet, but it does permit exploring a subterranean catacomb level up to right before its boss. At this point, the preview was formally over, but this build had one last surprise. Those hungry for more could test their mettle against the Hard Mode version of the Hayabusa Village, and suffice it to say that it was a test indeed.

Whether players desire an unforgiving challenge or one of the slickest 2D action experiences on the market, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound delivers. Despite committing to its ninja aesthetic, Ragebound seemingly hasn't left any significant parts of itself in the shadows, and that's perfectly fine. The game embodies the mixture of modern and classic Ninja Gaiden values that it purports to be, and anyone attracted to those should find exactly what they're looking for. If it stays the course, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound could become the game fans have been waiting for before Ninja Gaiden 4 itself comes out.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Reaches Incredible Subscriber Milestone
item.description:
Summary

  • Xbox Game Pass now reportedly has over 35 million subscribers.
  • According to Microsoft's latest official update, the service surpassed 34 million users as of February 2024. The next million might have already been added by mid-2024.

Xbox Game Pass has reportedly surpassed 35 million subscribers. However, the exact timing of this milestone is unconfirmed.

Xbox Game Pass celebrated its eighth anniversary on June 1. For the first half a decade of its existence, Microsoft regularly reported on its subscriber additions. As that growth began to slow, the company gradually stopped this practice. The last scheduled update came in January 2022, when Microsoft announced the service had surpassed 25 million users. Since then, updates on Xbox Game Pass growth have become sporadic and less direct, often referencing percentage increases for specific tiers like PC Game Pass rather than providing overall user numbers.

As of mid-2025, Xbox Game Pass has over 35 million subscribers. That's according to the LinkedIn profile of Microsoft Program Manager Kevin K. that was recently uncovered by Twitter user Timur222. The cited figure is 1 million higher than the Xbox Game Pass subscriber count that Microsoft reported in February 2024, which is still its latest update on the XGP user base as of today.

Xbox Game Pass May Have Surpassed 35 Million Subscribers in Mid-2024

Game Rant was unable to locate cached versions of the LinkedIn page used to source the claim, leaving the exact timing of the 35-million-user milestone unclear. Looking at historical trends, market research firm Omdia previously reported a significant slowdown in Xbox Game Pass growth, estimating it at 13% annuallyâ€”a two-point year-on-year declineâ€”as of late 2023. Several months later, Microsoft reported the service had surpassed 34 million users. Taken together, these data points suggest that Xbox Game Pass likely crossed the 35 million mark around mid-2024.

Xbox Game Pass Subscriber Count History

Month

Subscribers

Notes

July 2017

460,000

Launch month figure.

November 2017

1 million

April 2018

2 million

5 million

Not reported until April 2020.

18 million

25 million

December 2022

28.97 million

Omdia's estimate.

December 2023

33.3 million

Omdia's estimate.

February 2024

34 million

~Mid-2024

35 million

The milestone's exact timing is unconfirmed.

June 2025

38 million

Game Rant's estimate, based on recent CAGR.

More specifically, the milestone cited in the recently surfaced LinkedIn page might have been hit in April 2024. Assuming growth has continued to slow since then, dropping to around 10% annually, the service may still have over 38 million users as of mid-2025. A historically high user count would be consistent with the record Xbox Game Pass revenue Microsoft reported for Q2 2025, although the company did not disclose specific dollar figures at the time.

Microsoft's recent reporting pattern suggests the next official Xbox Game Pass subscriber update will come when the service reaches 40 or 45 million users. Based on its compound annual growth rate since 2022, that milestone could be reached between late 2025 and early 2027. In the meantime, Microsoft will be looking to add plenty of heavy hitters to Xbox Game Pass, some of which have just received release dates during the June 8 Xbox Games Showcase.

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Lumiere Edition to Be Restocked Later This Year
item.description:
Summary

  • The Lumiere Edition of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 will be restocked in October.
  • Pre-orders have been up periodically on GameStop's website.
  • This $70 package includes the game, 14 in-game outfits, and the same SteelBook and journal found in the Monolith Set.

The Lumiere Edition of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is set to be restocked soon for a release in October. Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 has become one of the most talked-about games of 2025, as it has impressed gamers and critics alike with its fluid turn-based combat, gripping storytelling, and intense music. A current frontrunner for Game of the Year , Expedition 33 is especially impressive considering it's Sandfall Interactive's very first game, a studio largely made up of ex-Ubisoft developers.

Despite coming with a price tag of $50 and being a day one Xbox Game Pass release, there are still swaths of gamers yearning for physical special editions of the game, a demand that Sandfall has been struggling to keep up with. To help appease fans who already own the game but have been wanting more physical Expedition 33 collectibles, Sandfall recently revealed the Monolith Set, a package which includes everything from the game's original Collector's Edition but without a copy of the game. Costing $120, Expedition 33 's Monolith Set offers a 20cm replica of the Paintress' Monolith that doubles as a music box, an expedition journal, and a SteelBook game case graced by Gustave and Maelle on the front and the Paintress in front of the monolith on the back.

For Clair Obscur fans looking for a less expensive special edition of the game, Sandfall Interactive has confirmed the return of Expedition 33 's Lumiere Edition. This $70 package includes the game, 14 in-game outfits, and the same SteelBook and journal from the Monolith Set. The Lumiere Edition currently shows "Not Available" on GameStop, with pre-orders selling out quickly over the weekend. However, it's expected to be going up for sale in waves, and it could go live again at any moment. This new restock of Expedition 33 's Lumiere Edition is stamped with an October 31 release date.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Lumiere Edition Restock Date

  • October 31, 2025

It seems that for now, only the PlayStation 5 version of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is returning, leaving Xbox gamers behind. However, with just how popular the game is, it wouldn't be a surprise to see Sandfall do the same for the Xbox Lumiere Edition as well at some point soon. It's possible that the game's current availability on Xbox Game Pass might be a reason that Sandfall is holding off bringing the Xbox version back to market, prioritizing PlayStation gamers as they don't have access to the game via PS Plus, PlayStation's Game Pass equivalent.

Those who've been waiting for the Lumiere Edition to finally jump into Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 will have a long road to wait until its October 31 release date. The silver lining is that the game will be fresher on the mind than most once awards season rolls around, which Expedition 33 is very likely to be a big part of. Interested gamers should keep checking the Lumiere Edition's GameStop page to snag their copy of Expedition 33 .
